intro: Monadenium yattanum, commonly known as the Yattanum spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as a low-growing shrub with yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough, hairy texture. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions, storing water in its thick stems and roots.
